org.apache.flink.api.common.functions

Interface FilterFunction<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the filtered elements.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Function, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmptyFieldsCountAccumulator.EmptyFieldFilter, PageRankBasic.EpsilonFilter, RichFilterFunction, WebLogAnalysis.FilterByRank, WebLogAnalysis.FilterDocByKeyWords, WebLogAnalysis.FilterVisitsByDate

    public interface FilterFunction<T>
extends Function, Serializable
    base interface for Filter functions. A filter function take elements and evaluates a predicate on them to decide whether to keep the element, or to discard it.

    The basic syntax for using a FilterFunction is as follows: 

    
 DataSet input = ...;
 
 DataSet result = input.filter(new MyFilterFunction());

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean filter(T value)
      The filter function that evaluates the predicate.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        boolean filter(T value)
               throws Exception
        The filter function that evaluates the predicate.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be filtered.
        Returns:
        True for values that should be retained, false for values to be filtered out.
        Throws:
        Exception - This method may throw exceptions. Throwing an exception will cause the operation to fail and may trigger recovery.
